EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as central storage.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-3.0, y=19.0) for iron smelting.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-4.0, y=21.0) for copper plate production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=0.5, y=21.5) with drop at (x=0.5, y=20.5)

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System) at base configuration
Consists of:
• Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) dedicated to automation research.
 – Electricity Group comprising:
  • Existing small electric poles at (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), (x=-4.5, y=15.5), (x=3.5, y=19.5) and (x=1.5, y=22.5).
  • Additional poles at (x=-7.5, y=16.5) and (x=-8.5, y=13.5); note the previously attempted pole at (x=-10.5, y=18.5) remains unconnected.
  • Merged network poles at (x=-17.5, y=13.5) and (x=-17.5, y=16.5).
 – Steam Engines:
  • Primary steam engine at (x=-13.5, y=16.5) with status NOT_CONNECTED.
  • Additional engines at (x=-14.5, y=13.5), (x=7.5, y=35.5) and (x=8.5, y=20.5) as previously detailed.
 – Fluid System Submodule – Boiler Module:
  • Pre-existing Boiler at (x=-13.5, y=19.0) (rotated; connection points at (x=-15.5, y=18.5) and (x=-11.5, y=18.5)) remains NOT_CONNECTED.
  • An intermediate pipe was successfully placed at (x=-17.5, y=21.5) in an attempt to bridge the pre-existing Boiler and its steam engine; the fluid connection between them failed.
  • New Boiler and Steam Engine Pair Attempt:
   – A new Boiler was placed at (x=-14.0, y=16.5) (status NOT_CONNECTED).
   – A new Steam Engine was manually placed at (x=-7.5, y=11.5) (status NOT_CONNECTED).
   – The fluid connection between the new pair failed due to insufficient pipe inventory.

### Remote Fluid Integration System at remote region (approximate center: x=-30, y=40)
Consists of:

• Boiler at (x=-29.0, y=33.5) for fluid heating.
• Pipe Connection established via a PipeGroup starting at (x=-30.5, y=31.5) through (x=-30.5, y=34.5) in sequential segments.

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Fluid Connection Failures:
 – Ensure that source and target fluid connection points are unobstructed and properly aligned.
 – Confirm sufficient pipe inventory before initiating connection attempts (e.g., a connection requiring 33 pipes failed with only 2 available).
 – Recalculate and verify intermediate candidate positions and buildable areas to avoid obstructions along the fluid path.

• Placement and Repositioning Challenges:
 – Validate that candidate positions are buildable and free of pre-existing objects before placement.
 – Consider available placement range; avoid attempting placement at positions too far from the player’s location.
 – Adjust target positions if forced placements or repositionings encounter terrain or object conflicts.

• Undefined Utility Functions:
 – Define all expected utility functions (for example, ensure that a function like shift_entity is implemented) to prevent NameError issues.

• Entity Retrieval and Forced Placement:
 – Verify that entities can be successfully retrieved prior to performing connection or repositioning operations.
 – Use functions like can_place_entity to pre-check candidate areas and avoid forced placement errors.

• General Placement and Resource Management:
 – Pre-assess both spatial constraints and inventory sufficiency to prevent cascading failures during fluid connection and entity relocation attempts.
